1. Copy this  
    `RESStorage get {{RESoptions}}`
1. Press **.** (period) to open the RES Console.  it's a thin black box.
1. Paste that command into it.
1. Press enter. An box will appear with a lot of text. 
1. Copy the text from the box out, paste it somewhere to keep.
1. Click **[ok]** to close the box.

1. Copy this  
    `RESStorage update {{RESoptions}}`
1. Press **.** (period) to open the RES Console.  it's a thin black box.
1. Paste that command into it.
1. Press enter. An box will appear with a lot of text. 
1. Copy-paste your text into that box.
1. Click **[confirm]** to save the text and close the box.

Unfortunately, this wasn't an upgrade. Instead, your browser trashed your RES settings and data.  That includes RES' memory that you didn't just install/upgrade this version of RES.  So, RES showed you the "what's new" page.

Look at the [big blue box at the top of this subreddit](/r/Enhancement/wiki/backing_up_res_settings) for details on how to back up your data and restore lost data from backups.

macros.description: Add buttons to insert frequently used snippets of text.

keepMacroListOpen.description: After selecting a macro from the dropdown list, do not hide the list.

macroPlaceholders.description:
When using macro, replace placeholders in text via pop-up prompt.

Example macro text:
The {{adj1}} {{adj2}} {{animal}} jumped over the lazy {{dog_color}} dog. The {{animal}} is so {{adj1}}!



Special placeholders:
{{now}}
The current date and time in your locale
{{selection}}
The currently selected text in the text area
{{my_username}}
/u/your_username
{{subreddit}}
/r/current_subreddit
{{url}}
URL (web address) for the current page
{{escaped}}
Escape markdown characters in the selected text; e.g. ** becomes \*\*
